Test tsagexastackup.tsc. setup=tsaginit. flags: CELL_WITH_QLC_DISK=1, NUM_FLASH_PER_CELL=2, FLASH_SIZE=256M, oss_testing=3, media_type=ALL, media_type_vault=ALL, CELL_WITH_FLASH_CACHE=^tmpvar^, egsrs_stop_timeout=60, dsk_size=regular, RECON_CELL_ATTEMPT_COUNT=12, dsksz=8192     ## 8.0 G each so 96G total, creatdev_file=tsagexastackup_pooldiskdef, nflint=1, ves_preinit=false, max_rpm=2000, egs_test=true, ers_test=true, egs_cert_dur_in_mins=40, egs_dsk_trcval=highest, egs_mem_trcval=highest, oss_large_exc_config=true, num_cells=3, setup5egs=true, sage_mirror_mode=high, max_cmd_rpm=1000, create_template_with_normal_redund=true, num_exc_servers=^oss_testing^, num_egs_servers=3, num_cell_servers=^oss_testing^, create_template_with_high_redund=true, egscnt=3, egs_servers=^T_WORK^'/egs1 '^CELL_TWORK2^'/egs2 '^CELL_TWORK2^'/egs3', disable_multims=true, egs_nw_mon_recon_time=90, _cell_state_dump_timeout_in_sec=10, enable_cmd=false, num_cmd_mirrors=3, delta_resync=false, egs_opid_offset=^egsopidoffset^, enable_reco=false, def_maxrpm=true, def_maxcmdrpm=true, egs_inactive_timeout=true, exc_mdb_or_interop=true, egslib_trace=l,m, osslib_trace=l,m, oss_exascale_testing=true, vesgds=true, ossviewroot=ADE_VIEW_ROOT_CV, use_predefined_rsa_key=false, privkey=priv.pem, pubkey=pub.pem, reflogname=tsagexastackup_noegs, tstlogname=^logfile^. platform: EXADATA.
LRGs: (none).
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagexastackup.tsc - Brings up the full ExaScale stack

oratst -d tsagexastackup.tsc [egs=false] [nginx_reconfig=true] \
             [ers=false] [sage_mirror_mode=high] \
             [data_only=true] [max_rpm=<numRPMs>] \
             [max_cmd_rpm=<numRPMs>] [cmd_mirror_mode=normal|high] \
  	       [delta_sync=true] [eds_trace=h,h] [privkey=<file>]
             [pubkey=<file>] [num_cells=<n>]
             [exc_cloud_user_ers_port=<port>]
             [egs_deplmode=<egs deployment mode>]
  	       [media_type=<XT,EF,HC|ALL> ] [disable_si_cc=true]
             [media_type_vault=<XT,EF,HC|ALL]
             [multisp=true]
             [setup5egs=true]
             [setup1egs=true]
             [egsopidoffset=<offset>]

       - sets up ExaScale Stack in view
 - if egs=false , it skips EGS setup and uses rpmmap.ora
       - if egs_trace=highest, highest level of disk and memory tracing
              will be enabled for EGS (Default is disk=low, memory=high)
       - if nginx_reconfig=true, nginx will be forcefully reconfigured
       - if ers=false, does not sets up ERS in the stack
       - if sage_mirror_mode=high, or oss_testing=3, 3 cellsrvs are setup
       - if sage_mirror_mode=normal, 3 cellsrvs are setup and many filetypes
            are created with normal redundancy
       - if num_cells=4, 4 cells will be setup - used for rebalance tests
       - if data_only=true, then only DATA StoragePoolRing will
              created. RECO (and EC) Rings will not be created.
            Default - Create DATA and RECO SPRings
       - If max_rpm is set, then the value specified will be used to
              configure the max. number of RPMs for the StoragePoolRings
              This value must be a multiple of 1000 and can be
              something >= 3000 and <= 512000
       - If max_cmd_rpm is set, then the value specified will be used to
              configure the max. number of RPMs for the container metadata
              Ring. This value must be a multiple of 1000 and can be
              something >= 3000 and <= 512000
         A special value of 4294967296 means, Container MetaData Ring will
              be disabled.
       - If cmd_mirror_mode is set to normal, container metadata uses
              3 mirrors. If it sets to high, container metadata uses
              6 mirrors. Default is high.
       - If delta_sync is set to true, then delta disks sync testing will
         	be enabled. Default is true.
       - if egsopidoffset is set to a non-zero interger, then EGS operation ID
           will set the operation ID to UB4MAXVAL + offset.
       - If dskoffline is set then script with exit after creating
                the rpmmap.ora.It is used by lrgsaexacldresync1.
       - If eds_trace is set, then add _eds_server_event for enabling tracing
       eds_trace=l,h means disk=low, memory=highest
       - If privkey and pubkey are passed, they should contain private key file
            and public key file corresponding to the generated RSA Key pair
          These options are useful if setup needs to use predefined keys
       - If diskSizeInMB is passed, use this size for pooldisk
                      (value Must be in MB, for ex - diskSizeInMB=2000)
       - If egs_autogenerate_mode is true, the automatic generation of
		  vault names will happen.
		   - if exc_normal is disable, normal redundancy ring operations are short-circuited
       - If raft_timeout_level is set to high, higher than normal values
            will be used in egs excloudinit.ora for raft timeouts
            Valid values for raft_timeout_level = regular (default), or high
      exc_cloud_user_ers_port=port
       - For cloud testing we want to use standard port of 5052 for ERS
       - If egs_deplmode is passed, the value will be used to deploy
            EGS cluster in the test. The valid values are:
            cloudService, cloudAtCustomer, onPrem (default), custom
       - media_type = Any combination of EF,HC,XT can be passed. Pass ALL
                      to create all 3 media types. Default is HC.
       - media_type_vault = Any media type which should be subset of media_type.
                      This will providion space on reqd media types for the default vault.
                      Default - Will use provision space on all available media types
       - multisp = true, This will mean - media_type=ALL, media_type_vault=ALL
                   Will create 3 Storage Pools, and default Vault will have
                   all 3 media types
       - If disable_si_cc is passed, then disable storage index and cc
       - setup5egs = If set, It will configure 5 EGS servers
       - setup1egs = If set, It will configure only 1 EGS servers
       - set SAVE_CELLSRVSTAT to save cellsrv related stats.

To run an lrg in a specific EGS deployment mode: pass a config parameter
       farm submit <lrg> -config "EGS_MODE=<mode>"
                 where mode = ExaCS (to run in cloudService deployment),
                              ExaCC (cloudAtCustomer deployment)

     To track errors in real time and get email notification,
     Please use the following config parameters:
       farm submit <lrg> -config "TRACK_ERROR=true;
              ERROR_MSG=error1|error2|error3;MODE=ABORT/MAIL;
              TO_MAIL=<email_address>"
       Currently the files being tracked are mentioned in
       tsagerror_tracker_tracefile.dat. Please add full location of
       any other file which you want to track.
       Example : farm submit lrgsaexacldegs5 -config "TRACK_ERROR=true;ERROR_MSG=ORA-00600: internal
       error code, arguments: [EgsMain:InitNetworkConnect]|ORA-00700: soft internal error,
       arguments: [EdsRemoteIO::checkServiceThreadHung:egslib_hung];MODE=MAIL;
       TO_MAIL=xyz@oracle.com"
       For more details about parameters, please refer to file tsagerror_tracker.tsc

    To collect cellsrv stat periodically in farm runs
    Please use the following config parameters
      farm submit <lrgname> -config "EXADATA_STAT_COLLECTION=true;EXADATA_STAT_NAME=CELLSRVSTAT;INTERVAL=10"
      Explanation of parameters :
      EXADATA_STAT_COLLECTION=true : Turn on stats collection
      EXADATA_STAT_NAME=CELLSRVSTAT/ECSTAT
      INTERVAL=10 : specify the interval of stat collection in seconds, for example-
                    INTERVAL=10 will invoke and save cellsrv output every 10 seconds.

    Step 2 - Validate if Rest Subscriber is setup or not

    Step 4.1 - Generate Hardware alerts (Test 1) and store the dumps in file.

    Step 5.1 - Generate ADR Alerts (Test 2) and store dumps in a file.
    Step 5.2 - Kill Cellsrv to generate an alert in alerthistory
    Step 5.3 - Validate the alerts have been generated for ADR

     and 1 HC disk fails/shutdown.

     3) Create EF template

Test tsagexc_aep_bug38178358.tsc. setup=(none). flags: (none). platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgsaexcaep10.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexc_aep_bug38178358.tsc - Functional test for BUG-38178358

38178358 - SOME EXASCALE SERVICES DID NOT COME UP AFTER CELL ROLLING UPGRADE TO 25.2.0.0.0.250708
     Test steps  :
        1. Setup Exascale 3 cell multims with AEP disabled
        2. List lscluster & lsservice before enabling AEP
        3. Enable AEP using chcluster --attributes servicePlacement=auto
        4. Make sure AEP configure the services as per the intial replica count configs which is 1
        5. Set _exc_egs_aep_ms_to_wait_before_gc_offline_processes=100000 in excloudinit.ora in 3 cells
        6. Run 'ebs_simevent[AEP_REPLICA_COUNTS_NORMAL]' in all 3 cells
        7. Wait for all services replica counts to 3 in dynamic loop wait
        8. Kill bsw, egs, syseds, usreds and ers on a cell which is not EGS leader
        9. Sleep for 65 mins, we giving more time for AEP to make placement decsion of replica counts to 2
        10. Wait for all services replica counts to 2 in dynamic loop wait
        11. Run 'ebs_simevent[AEP_CRASH_ON_CELL_CNT_CHANGE]' in EGS leader cell
        12. Wait for all services replica counts to 3 in dynamic loop wait

Description: tsagexc_conf_rebal_egs.tsc - double failure case

Test steps:

 i.) - setup 3 cell env with db

 ii.) - - Start a db workload in background

 In a loop (count 3); do

     iii.) - On cell 1- simulate confinement on hard disk

     iv.)  -On cell 2; simulate failure on a hard disk (will trigger rebal)

Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_VOL, EXAC_VOLCORE, EXAC_VOL_LITE.
Description: tsagexc_dbonattsnapvol.tsc - setup asm + exascale + blockstore + edv

This test does the following:
      1. setup 2 dbs, db 1 on exascale and db 2 on asm + blockstore + edv
      2. create a volume and edv attachment of it
      3. create asm diskgroup BACKUP from volume attachment device
      4. create tablespace and table in asm db
      5. add records to table for sanity check
      6. take backup on BACKUP dg using rman
      7. after taking backup create a snapshot and thin clone of the volume
      8. rename BACKUP dg to BACKUP_DB2_SNAP and use the asm diskstring of new cloned volume
      9. create a new database from backed up data on BACKUP_DB2_SNAP diskgroup
     10. validate functionality of new and asm db. Both dbs should be up and running
     11. cleanup
         11.1 delete tables, tablespaces and shutdown both databases
         11.2 drop diskgroups BACKUP and BACKUP_DB2_SNAP
         11.3 shutdown asm
         11.4 delete blockstore entities

Test tsagexc_rdsreset.tsc. setup=(none). flags: node_1=^node1^.us.oracle.com, node_2=^node2^.us.oracle.com. platform: (none).
LRGs: (none).
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagexc_rdsreset.tsc - Wrapper script file for RDS-Reset Exawatcher

Test cases for RDS-Reset Exawatcher and cover below cases
         1. Normal case
            - Check if RDS-connection is established
            - Make sure the "Count:" in the first line is 30
         2. RDS hang case
            - Additional sysinfo* tar file will be present in post-reset collection(netdiag tar file)
            - Look for diagnostic traces and make sure the QP number in the post-reset collection (netdiag tar file) is different from the previous one
            - There should be 12 files under QP_INFO directory in total for IB Nodes
            - There should be 7 files under QP_INFO directory in total for RoCE Nodes
         3. Customized command normal case
            - Replace RDSinfo command in /opt/oracle.ExaWatcher/ExaWatcher.conf as below and restart exawatcher
                 - '/opt/oracle.ExaWatcher/RDSinfoExaWatcher.sh --no-reset 2>/dev/null'
            - Check if RDS-connection is established
            - Make sure the "Count:" in the first line is 30
         4. Customized command RDS hang case
            - Replace RDSinfo command in /opt/oracle.ExaWatcher/ExaWatcher.conf as below and restart exawatcher
                 - '/opt/oracle.ExaWatcher/RDSinfoExaWatcher.sh --no-reset 2>/dev/null'
            - Check if RDS-connection is established
            - Look for diagnostic traces and make sure the QP number in the post-reset collection (netdiag tar file) is same from the previous one
         5. Invalid command normal case
            - Replace RDSinfo command in /opt/oracle.ExaWatcher/ExaWatcher.conf as below and restart exawatcher
                 - '/opt/oracle.ExaWatcher/RDSinfoExaWatcher.sh aaa bbb 2>/dev/null'
            - Check if RDS-connection is established
            - Make sure the "Count:" in the first line is 30
         6. Invalid command RDS hang case
            - Replace RDSinfo command in /opt/oracle.ExaWatcher/ExaWatcher.conf as below and restart exawatcher
                 - '/opt/oracle.ExaWatcher/RDSinfoExaWatcher.sh aaa bbb 2>/dev/null'
            - Check if RDS-connection is established
            - Additional sysinfo* tar file will be present in post-reset collection(netdiag tar file)
            - Look for diagnostic traces and make sure the QP number in the post-reset collection (netdiag tar file) is different from the previous one
            - There should be 12 files under QP_INFO directory in total for IB Nodes
            - There should be 7 files under QP_INFO directory in total for RoCE Nodes
         7. Peer reboot case
            - Reboot the peer node
            - Make sure that QP number becomes -1 for the established connection

Test tsagexc_reset_aep_replica_count.tsc. setup=(none). flags: (none). platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgsaexcaep11.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexc_reset_aep_replica_count.tsc - Test for resetAutoServicePlacement with simulation of 2 & 3 cells

1.  Setup Exascale 3 cell multims with AEP disabled
     2.  List lscluster & lsservice before enabling AEP
     3.  Enable AEP using chcluster --attributes servicePlacement=auto
     4.  Make sure AEP configure the services as per the intial replica count configs which is 1
     5.  Set _exc_egs_aep_ms_to_wait_before_gc_offline_processes=100000 in excloudinit.ora in 3 cells
     6.  Run âebs_simevent[AEP_REPLICA_COUNTS_NORMAL]â in all 3 cells
     7.  Wait for all services replica counts to 3 in dynamic loop wait
     8.  Modify one of the replica count to 2 (chcluster for bsm and bsw, test for both of them individually
          so that the whole test repeats for both kinds of services)
     9.  Remove a cell by putting one of the cells in offline-maintenance of non egs leader
     10. Wait for 5mins
     11. Expect no changes to lscluster
     12. Execute the resetaep command
     13. Wait 2 minutes.
     14. AEP should setup replica counts (lscluster values) suitable for a 2-cell setup
     15. Modify one of the replica counts to 3 (syseds, usreds, bsm and bsw : repeat the test for all of these so that we have
         comprehensive coverage)
     16. Bring up the offline-maintenance of non egs leader
     17. Wait for 3 minutes.
     18. AEP should not make any changes to replica counts (lscluster)
     19. Execute the resetaep command
     20. Wait for 2 minutes
     30. AEP should setup replica counts (lscluster values) suitable for a 3-cell setup.

Description: tsagexc_volsnap_metadata.tsc - Test for the fix of missing volume snapshot metadata

Test Steps:
       1. Create a volume (1:.*), take its snapshot (1.1:.*) and create its clone/backup
       2. Set crash on BSWDELETESNAPJOB_DELETE_SNAP_SUBMIT (job 136, state 6)
       3. Delete the snapshot
       4. Wait for restore
       5. Check if metadata remains -
          a. lsvolumesnapshot should not return output (1.1:.*)
          b. Create a new snapshot. Its id should be 1.2:.* since 1.1:.* metadata still remains
       6. Delete backup/clone and remaining snapshot (1.2:.*)

Test should be run for 3 cases -
       1. Create clone from snapshot
       2. Create backup from snapshot
       3. Create both clone and backup from snapshot

      2. Start the loop for each xml in iovworkload
      3. In the loop, Run IOV workload in the background
      4. select and Fail a disk based on rpmentries from ves dump
      5. Verify alerts - Being Dropped/Rebalance starting/Dropped/Rebalance
         finished
      6. Drop and replace the failed disk
      7. Verify alerts - Being Added/Rebalance starting/Added/Rebalance
         finished

      9. dump file and Check md5sum
      10. End loop once all xmls are covered and save all logs

Test tsagexcbug37788743.tsc. setup=(none). flags: (none). platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgdbcsaexcdss1.
Suites: EXAC_DB, EXAC_EDS, EXAC_REGRESS, SAGE_EXAC_SHORT.
Description: tsagexcbug37788743.tsc - Test for bug 37788743

In EXC, every smart scan IO needs to pass/successfully complete a XLN
     phase (via PredicateDiskXln).  This is because of bugs 34707983, 35485022
     where VES doesn't perform RPM checks for XRMEM smart scan IOs.  As a
     result, we need to fail the smart scan IO even before issuing the IO if
     XLN fails.  When XLN fails, in PredicateDisk::createPredicateMapElems(),
     we mark the IO with an error and start attempting to return the
     unprocessed back to RDBMS for retry.  This is done without breaking the
     IO into smart scan's usual 1MB units.

     In bug 37788743, a smart scan IO failed XLN phase and was added to an
     output buffer, ready to be returned to RDBMS.  However, there were some
     buffer pressure and cellsrv decided to evict an output buffer with this
     failed IO.  When evicting an output buffer and requeuing the IO for
     processing, PredicateDisk checks that the IO was broken up into smart
     scan's usual 1MB units.  This assert triggers for smart scans that failed
     XLN earlier, leading to:

     ORA-00600: internal error code, arguments:
       [PD::recreateIORequestFromEvictedFilteredMap_1], [8388608], [8388608], [1048576]

     The fix is to check whether the IO should be retried/requeued in cellsrv
     or sent back to RDBMS.

     Added a new test event to simulate XLN failure and output buffer eviction.
       alter cell events ="cellsrv_simevent[PRED_XLN_FAIL_EVICT] frequency = 1";

Test for bug 37788743

Test tsagexcbug38108274.tsc. setup=(none). flags: (none). platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgdbcsaexcdss3_gdbclone.
Suites: EXAC_DB, EXAC_EDS, EXAC_GDBCLONE, EXAC_MEDIUM, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcbug38108274.tsc - Test for bug 38108274

During latch recovery, CLMN/PMON tries to restore the another process's
     edslibctx to a consistent state so that it can be cleaned up and freed.
     Since edslibctx being recovered is from another process, we should not
     access anything in edslibctx that belong to the other process's private
     memory, which includes edsblictx->gp_edslib_ctx,
     edslibctx->diagctx_edslib_ctx, and edslibctx->membucket_edslib_ctx.

     In edslibmsg, latch recovery called into function that had diag traces
     and asserts that use these private edslibctx members, leading to
     the following asserts:

     ORA-07445: exception encountered: core dump [edslibmsg_remove_msg_from_free()+76]
       [SIGSEGV] [ADDR:0x7FC2B9A0873C] [PC:0x5578BFC] [Address not mapped to object]

     Fix is to remove diag traces/asserts from latch recovery code.

     New test events are added to cause a SEGV while holding edslibmsg latch:
       alter session set events='27606 trace name context forever, level 0x00800000';
       alter session set events='27606 trace name context forever, level 0x01000000';
       alter session set events='27606 trace name context forever, level 0x02000000';

    Without the fix, the above assert can be observed in this test.
    With the fix, this test runs clean.

Test for bug 38108274

Description: tsagexccelloffline.tsc - cell offline test

cell offline test
     1. Shutdown all EGS servers.
     2. Shutdown one cellsrv.

Test tsagexccellsrvredund.tsc. setup=(none). flags: sage_mirror_mode=high, setup_blockstore=true. platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgdbcsaexcsrvredund1.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexccellsrvredund.tsc - Test for redundancy check after cellsrv
                                shutdown

Test steps for pure exascale env:
     - Bring up Exascale rack with high redundancy with all services running
       (SYS-EDS, USR-EDS, ERS, BSM, BSW, EGS).
     - Shutdown cellsrv check:
     1. Shutdown cellsrv on cell 1
     2. Make sure cellsrv is gone using ps
     3. Wait for 12 "ExaScale PoolDisk.*is in OFFLINE_MAINTENANCE" messages in
        leader egs alert log
     4. Switch to cell 2 and try to shutdown cellsrv. It should fail.
     5. look for "EgsStoragePoolMgmtJob.*removed from OFFLINE_MAINTENANCE list
        due to PartnerDisk is OFFLINE or will be taken OFFLINE on cell
        EDSCELL2" in EGS traces
     6. Switch back to first cell and startup cellsrv
     7. Wait for 12 "ExaScale PoolDisk.*is ONLINE" messages in leader egs
        alert log
     - Shutdown all services check:
       Repeat the same steps mentioned above, except in step (4). In step (4),
       instead of shutting down only cellsrv, shut down all services. Here,
       the cellsrv shutdown should fail.

     Test steps for hybrid (EXC + ASM) env:
     1. Shutdown cellsrv on cell 1
     2. Make sure cellsrv is gone using ps
     3. Wait for 12 "ExaScale PoolDisk.*is in OFFLINE_MAINTENANCE" messages in
        leader egs alert log
     4. Switch to cell 2 and try to shutdown cellsrv. It should fail.
     5. Switch back to first cell and startup cellsrv
     6. Wait for 12 "ExaScale PoolDisk.*is ONLINE" messages in leader egs
        alert log
     7. Inactivate a griddisk on cell 1
     8. Switch to cell 2 and try to shutdown cellsrv. It should fail.
     9. Switch back to first cell and activate the griddisk
    10. Inactivate a pooldisk on cell 1
    11. Switch to cell 2 and try to shutdown cellsrv. It should fail.
     9. Switch back to first cell and activate the pooldisk

For pure exascale - lrgdbcsaexcsrvredund1
     For hybrid exascale - lrgdbcsaexchybrid5

Description: tsagexcchmodemultibsw.tsc - test to change iscsi mode in a multi bsw setup

1.setup bsw in iscsi mode - 2 bsm, 3 bsw
     2.kill bsw3.
     3.change bsw1 to non iscsi mode. try mkvolume - mkvolume fails, we get "Volume creation attempt in mixed mode"
     4.chnage bsw2 to non iscsi mode. try mkvolumec - mkvolume is success
     5.change bsw1 back to iscsi mode. try mkvolume - mkvolume is success
     6.change bsw2 back to iscsi mode. try mkvolume - mkvolume will give "BSM ioctl op code 18001"
     7. restart bsm and bsw. try mkvolume.

     changing is mode is done by adding/removing the iscsi lies.
     adding iscsi lines to excloudinit.ora, to change mode from non iscsi to iscsi.
     removing iscsi line from excloudinit.ora, to change mode from iscsi to non iscsi.

Test tsagexcchmodetoiscsi.tsc. setup=xblockini. flags: (none). platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldbswmix1.
Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_VOL, EXAC_VOLCORE.
Description: tsagexcchmodetoiscsi.tsc - changing cluster mode from non iscsi mode to iscsi mode

1. Setup blockstore in non iscsi mode
     2. Add iscsi lines to excloudinit.ora
     3. Shutdown bsw using cellcli and start bsw using startBSW.sh -
         BSW does not restart, as a volume is already present and cluster mode is set
     4. Undo the checnges done to excloudinit.ora, shutdown bsm and bsw using cellcli
     5. Run cleanup.sh
     6. Start BSM and BSW using cellcli commands.
     7. Add iscsi lines to excloudinit.ora
     8. Shutdown bsw using cellcli and start bsw using startBSW.sh
     9. mkvolume cmd fails with - "Error code: 10026 - No valid VIP for volume create"
        we started the setup in iscsi mode(where mk commands work without VIPs)
        now the setup is changed to iscsi mode, thus the requirement to create VIPs,
        before using mk commands
     10. Create VIPs using createVip.sh
     11. mkVolume command succeeds, volume is created.

Test tsagexcchmodetononiscsi.tsc. setup=xblockini. flags: iscsi=true. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldbswmix2.
Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_VOL, EXAC_VOLCORE.
Description: tsagexcchmodetononiscsi.tsc - changing cluster mode from iscsi mode to non iscsi mode

1. Setup blockstore in iscsi mode
     2. Remove iscsi lines from excloudinit.ora
     3. Stop BSW service by using stopBSW.sh and Start BSW by using cellcli
        BSW does not start, as a volume is already present, cluster mode is set.
        mode change is not allowed.
     4. Adding iscsi lines to excloudinit.ora
     5. Shut down BSM and BSW service using cellcli commands
     6. Cleanup using cleanup.sh
     7. Start BSM service using cellcli and BSW service using startBSW.sh
     8. Remove iscs ilines from excloudinit.ora (to convert the setup to non iscsi mode)
     9. Stop BSW using stopBSW.sh and start BSW service using cellcli
     10. Run mkvolume, volume gets created.
         Here, we are now in non iscsi mode setup, thus VIP creatioin is not required.

Description: tsagexcdcnsp.tsc - Drop sp and create sp more than 10 times and make sure top 10 heap values less than 10MB

Test follows the below sequence
    1- Create an ExaScale stack with 3 cells.
    2- Drop the current storage pool.
    3- Get heap dump from the EGS leader:
        CellCLI> alter cell egsevents="immediate excsrv.ebs_dump(sgaheapsummary, 1, 0)"
    4- Repeat the following steps 10 times:
        (a) Create a storage pool with a new name.
        (b) Offline and online pool disks of cell-1.
        (c) Drop the storage pool.
    5- Get heap dump from the EGS leader, again:
        CellCLI> alter cell egsevents="immediate excsrv.ebs_dump(sgaheapsummary, 1, 0)"
    6- Make sure the top 10 memory users in the heap dump have not increased significantly (say the difference should be less than 50 MB)

Test tsagexcdiskofflinetimeout.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: vault_db=DATA, sage_mirror_mode=high. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldegs16.
Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_VES.
Description: tsagexcdiskofflinetimeout.tsc - Disk Offline timeout

The test includes the following steps
    1.  Start a non-rdbms stack with a 3 cell setup
    2.  Run a IOV workload to populate XRMEM cache
    3.  Set Disk Offline timer to 0 (diskOfflineTimerInMins=0)
    4.  Dump XRMEM lru: (using event cli for 'dumplru',0,3,3)
    5.  Offline any griddisk
    5.  Wait for rebalance to finish
    6.  Online the griddisk
    7.  Wait for the format to finish
    8.  Look again for XRMEM population after format (using dumplru)
    9.  Grep for the pattern to note the differences in step 4 & 8

    Trace files to look for and examine:
    1. EGS Alert logs for state transitions in rebalance and format
    2. Cell alert log to translate griddisk number to its name
    3. IOV workload trace file
    4. dumplru trace files from steps 4 & 8

    How to execute steps:
    escli --wallet $T_WORK/esadmin_wallet/ chstoragepool OPC_HC_STORAGE --attributes diskOfflineTimerInMins=0
    alter cell events = "immediate cellsrv.cellsrv_nvcache('dumplru',0,3,3);
    alter griddisk HC_cell1_CD_exdisk6_EDSCELL1 inactive/active
    Extract a griddisk_num from 1st dumplru trace file:
     - grep "cnt.*dloc" <dumplru_trc1> | grep -v "dloc 0" | head -1 | sed -e 's/.*dloc \([1-9].*\)/\1/g' -e 's/ .*//g'
    Get the line count for active cache headers for that disk in dumplru trace files:
     - grep "grep "cnt.*dloc <gridisk_num>" <dumplru_trc1/2> | wc -l

Description: tsagexcdropdeadesnp.tsc - Drop dead ESNP RAFT/fence metadata

This test covers the case when ESNP is evicted, all its associated
     RAFT/fence metadata should get cleared.

Steps in the test are as follows :
     1. Check intially ESNP should exist and store it's id
     2. Shutdown ESNP and sleep for 60 seconds
     3. Disable the dead ESNP
     4. Check for dead ESNP alerts in egs traces
     5. Check there is no ESNP service running now
     6. Startup ESNP
     7. Check ESNP is now started with a new id

Description: tsagexcedsmdrepair.tsc - Test for 1 cell extent repair

###############################################################
     ###  Test for corrupted extent repair in 1 Cell Setup
    1. Exascale setup
    2. Drop Flash Cache and set the configuration
       cellcli -e drop flashcache all; echo "_cell_ves_max_bad_ext_md=-1" >> $T_WORK/cellinit.ora;
    3. Create a Vault DATA1 and file file1 inside it.
    4. Corrupt the metadata for file1 and exciogen transalation to get the extent and disk
       exciogenÂ -file @DATA1/file1Â -type trans -offset 0 -size 8192
    5. Use extent id and disk from exciogen to get
       priCDOffset and secCDOffset from ves_dump cellcli output
    6. Corrupt the metadata by using the disk and priCDOffset and secCDOffset
        dd if=/dev/zero of=^raw^/$cell_disk count=1 bs=2048 oflag=seek_bytes seek=$pricdoffset conv=notrunc
        dd if=/dev/zero of=^raw^/$cell_disk count=1 bs=2048 oflag=seek_bytes seek=$seccdoffset conv=notrunc
    7. Restart the cell and read the file @DATA1/file1.
       Reading @DATA1/file1 should return error.
        Error message: XSH-11: Cannot discover Exascale storage
    8. Check for "VES_RepairCorruptedExtJob" and "cannot find forward target (error 22)" in trace
    9. Reading again file1 should return same error
############################################################

Extent Repair test for 1 cell setup
      LRG: lrgsaexacldeds2

LRGs: (none).

Description: tsagexcedsmdrepair2.tsc - Test for unavailable extent repair in 3 Cell
                          using VES_BulkMoveJob before successful repair extent

###############################################################
     ###  Test for corrupted extent repair in 3 Cell VES_BulkMoveJob
    1. Exascale 3 Cell setup
    2. Create a Vault DATA1 and file file1 inside it.
    3. Use exciogen transalation to get cell and swithch Cell con text
    4. Drop Flash Cache and set the configuration
       cellcli -e drop flashcache all; echo "_cell_ves_max_bad_ext_md=-1" >> $T_WORK/cellinit.ora;
    5. Use exciogen to perform transalation on file1 to get extent id and disk number.
    6. Use extent id and disk from exciogen to get
       priCDOffset and secCDOffset from ves_dump cellcli output
    7. Corrupt the metadata  and change config parameter
        dd if=/dev/zero of=$OSS_DEVDIR/$cell_disk2 count=1 bs=200 oflag=seek_bytes seek=$pricdoffset2 conv=notrunc
        dd if=/dev/zero of=$OSS_DEVDIR/$cell_disk2 count=1 bs=200 oflag=seek_bytes seek=$seccdoffset2 conv=notrunc
        cellsrv.cellsrv_setparam(_cell_ves_simulation, 32)
    8. Restart the cell and read the file @DATA1/file1.
       Reading @DATA1/file1 should return error.
        Error message: XSH-11: Cannot discover Exascale storage
    9. Check for message: "ves_read operates on a corrupted extent" in trace
    10. Wait for 35 second and read file1 again, it should return more lines than step 9
    11. Change the configuration and read file1 after 40 second.
        It should return same numbers of lines as in Step 10  in trace.
    12. Write to corrupted extent should succeed and return same number of message in trace
    13. Restart the Cell and read file1 again, it should return same number of message in trace
###############################################################

Test for successful extent repair using VES_BulkMoveJob
    LRG: lrgsaexacldeds3

Test tsagexcedsmdrepair2_resilver.tsc. setup=(none). flags: oss_multims_testing=true, sage_mirror_mode=high. platform: (none).
LRGs: (none).
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagexcedsmdrepair2_resilver.tsc -

Create test file  make vault, create file, write 4K data, and verify with cat.

Detect primary cell  run exciogen on the file and source the matching cell context script.

Reset flashcache  flush and drop flashcache, then set _cell_ves_max_bad_ext_md=-1 in cellinit.ora.

Block repairs  inject VES_JOB_HANG event to hang upcoming repair jobs.

Corrupt secondary SAP  zero out the secondary SAP block on disk.

Trigger resilvering  recreate flashcache and fire ves_corrupt_extent_sap event, then confirm hang in logs.

Restart cell services  reboot cellsrv and wait ~5 minutes to see repair job entries in trace logs.

Validate data  read file from all mirrors (--imirror=0/1/2) and ensure data matches.

Test tsagexcedsspaceused.tsc. setup=(none). flags: (none). platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgdbcsaexcedset2.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_EDS, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcedsspaceused.tsc - Space used calculation tests on EDS dataset

This test consists following testcases:
    1. Check that the datasets correctly calculate the sizes of
        the auto-generated files after startup
    2. Check that space calculation = provisioned space and
       that provisioned space is correct for the media types
    3. Does the provisioned size correctly scale with the redundancy?
    4. Test adding, resizing, and deleting clones and snapshots
    5. Calculating space used when both allocated size and
       provisioned size are present. Different cases are:
     i. Do we take the larger of provisioned size and allocated size for a single file?
    ii. Do clones share provisioned size cushion as allocated size grows?
   iii. Do clones share provisioned size as provisioned size grows?
    iv. Does allocated size update correctly as we delete clones?
     v. Does allocated size update correctly when we delete invisible nodes and snapshots?
    vi. Does allocated size update correctly if we move nodes to a different dataset?
   vii. Does provisioned + allocated size update correctly when nodes in different datasets are deleted?
    6. Space allocated update could be blocked for a long time

Test tsagexcegsdiskdiscovery.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: sage_mirror_mode=high. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexcdiskdiscovery.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_MEDIUM, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcegsdiskdiscovery.tsc - Test for disk discovery

Drop and create storagepool with hang "EGS_DD_BEF_PERS_HANG"

Test Steps
     1. Drop the OPC_HC_STORAGE storage pool.
     2. Find which Cell the EGS leader is running on and switch to that Cell instance.
     3. Simulate the Cell event that will cause the EGS leader to hang for 5 minutes
         when running the create SP command before running disk discovery
         cellcli -e 'alter cell egsEvents="ebs_simevent[EGS_DD_BEF_PERS_HANG] count=1"'.
     4. Create Storage Pool command.
     5. Wait for 1 minute.
     6. Cancel the hang simulation event on the Cell instance where the current EGS leader is running
      cellcli -e 'alter cell egsEvents="ebs_simevent[EGS_DD_BEF_PERS_HANG] off"'
     7. Run cellcli -e "alter physicaldisk '''<disk_name>''' simulate failuretype=failed"
     8. Kill the EGS leader to trigger leader re-election
     9. After step 4 finishes, run the ESCLI command "lsstoragepool --detail" to
         check that the Storage Pool OPC_HC_STORAGE is successfully created.
     10. Grep for "OPC_HC_STORAGE is Operational" from the egs alert_*.log files.
     11. Cancel the simulated disk failure
     12. Startup the previously killed EGS leader

Test tsagexcegsdiskdiscovery4.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: num_cells=4, media_type=HC,EF, delta_sync=true. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexcdiskdiscovery2.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcegsdiskdiscovery4.tsc - Test for disk discovery

Drop and create HC and EF storagepool with hang "EGS_DD_AFT_PERS_HANG"

Test Steps
     1.  Drop the OPC_HC_STORAGE and OPC_EF_STORAGE storage pools.
     2.  Create the OPC_HC_STORAGE storage pool in the background. After waiting
          for 30 seconds, also create the OPC_EF_STORAGE storage pool in the
          background.
     3.  Wait for more than 1 minute and validate the creation of both storage pools.
          Run the ESCLI command "lsstoragepool --detail" to check that the
          OPC_HC_STORAGE and OPC_EF_STORAGE are successfully created.
          Grep for "OPC_HC_STORAGE is Operational" and "OPC_EF_STORAGE is Operational"
          from the egs alert_*.log files.
     4.  Find which Cell the EGS leader is running on and switch to a Cell instance
         where the EGS leader is not running on.
     5.  Run the command cellcli -e drop griddisk all prepare with the argument
          prefix equal to "HC_cell" and "EF_cell". This marks all the HC and EF
          griddisks on that Cell instance for drop during alter SP reconfig.
     6.  Switch to the Cell instance where the EGS leader is running.
     7.  Simulate the Cell event that will cause the EGS leader to hang for 5 minutes
          when running the alter SP reconfig command before running disk discovery
          cellcli -e 'alter cell egsEvents="ebs_simevent[EGS_DD_AFT_PERS_HANG] count=1"'.
     8.  Run alter storagepool --reconfig command for both OPC_HC_STORAGE and
          OPC_EF_STORAGE in the background at the same time.
     9.  Wait for longer than 1 minute.
     10. Cancel the hang simulation event on the Cell instance where the current EGS leader is running
          cellcli -e 'alter cell egsEvents="ebs_simevent[EGS_DD_AFT_PERS_HANG] off"'
     11. Run cellcli -e "alter physicaldisk '''<disk_name>''' simulate failuretype=failed"
          to fail 1 HC disk and 1 EF disk.
     12. Kill the EGS leader to trigger leader re-election
     13. After step 8 finishes, run the ESCLI command "lsstoragepool --detail" to
          check the state of OPC_HC_STORAGE and OPC_EF_STORAGE.
     14. Grep for "alter storagepool OPC_HC_STORAGE resize.*successful" from the egs alert_*.log files.
     15. Cancel the simulated disk failures
     16. Wait for 2 minutes and grep for "ExaScale PoolDisk.*DROPPED permanently"
          from the egs alert_*.log files to check for number of disks dropped.
     17. Startup the previously killed EGS leader

LRGs: lrgsaexcsandbox7.

Description: tsagexcegssandbox13.tsc - EGS Sandbox Tests

Test Scenarios Included -
      Test is added based on the scenario in Bug - 33495791

     Scenario 1 -
      1. Set disk expiry timer to 2 mins.
      2. Set diskstate of disk on cell-0 to inaccessible_unknown
      3. EGS will offline the disk
      4. After 2 minutes, EGS will force drop the disk.
      5. Sleep for a random time, so that test choses to wait or not wait
          until rebalance is complete
      6. Set disk state to accessible_good, EGS will force add the disk
      7. While rebalance is going on, set disk state to inaccessible_unknown
      8. After 2 mins, EGS will force drop the disk
      9. Again, sleep for a random time, so that test choses to wait or not
          wait until rebalance is complete
     10. Set disk state to accessible_good, EGS will force add the disk
     11. Wait for rebalance to complete

     Scenario 2 -
      Same as scenario 1, but in Step 7 disk state is set to dead
      and the disk will be force dropped immediately

Test tsagexcegssandbox14.tsc. setup=(none). flags: test_name=^tst_tscname^a. platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgsaexcsandbox8.
Suites: EXAC_EGS_SANDBOX, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcegssandbox14.tsc - EGS Sandbox Tests

This txn addresses disk restrictions during upgrade. Previously, the
     restrictions on disks going down for maintenance were overly strict
     which forced cells to upgrade in sequence, instead of in parallel.
     This txn loosens the restrictions, so that cells from different
     groups can do down in parallel (but cells in the same group cannot)

     UPDATE: Now, in cell ring model, we check for parallel upgradations
       as follows:
       1. Request for 3 cells maintenance, of which 2 cells will be in same
          group, and 3rd cell's group will not overlap with first two cells.
       2. 3rd cell and one of the cell from 1st group will go into maintenance.
       3. Bring back the cell froe first group that went into
          maintenance.
       4. Now, the other cell should go into maintenance along with the
          3rd cell, which was already in maintenance.

Test tsagexcenrollfail.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: (none). platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldescli6.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_ESCLI, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcenrollfail.tsc - Test for unauthorized user trying to enroll using edstool

After bringing up exastackup do the following for setup:
      1. Create a new directory and copy the existing wallet there:
           cd $T_WORK; mkdir tmpdir; cd tmpdir;
           cp -r ../eswallet .
           cp ../*ora .
      2. Run edstool here once to make sure we have all the required files in the new directory.
      3. OSSCONF should point to  $T_WORK/tmpdir/
      4. Change the credentials associated with the user info found in the wallet
           export OSSCONF=$T_WORK/tmpdir/
           escli> mkkey --private-key-file privatekey.pem --public-key-file publickey.pem
           escli> chwallet --wallet eswallet/ --private-key-file privatekey.pem
      5. Run edstool, having OSSCONF pointing to $T_WORK/tmpdir/
           This should fail, and in the trace file for edstool
           found in $ADE_VIEW_ROOT/oracle/diag/asm/use*/host_*/trace
           there should be a message "[TLS] Enrollment failed because the user was not authorized to enroll"

Test tsagexcesclivaultspace.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: (none). platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldvaultspace.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcesclivaultspace.tsc - File creation tests

This test covers the cases :
     1. CREATING FILES GREATER THAN PROVISIONED SPACE IN VAULT AND CLONING THEM
     2. MATERIALISING THE FILES AND THEN CLONING THEM
     3. BUG 35325283 - VAULT PROVISIOINABLE SPACE IS NOT BEING APPLIED
        CORRECTLY TO SNAPSHOTS AND CLONES
     4. SPACE QUOTA EXCEEDED ERROR - CASE 1 - MATERIALISING FILE
     5. SPACE QUOTA EXCEEDED ERROR - CASE 2 - MATERIALISING SNAPSHOTS

This test covers the following cases:
     (1) File creation: check if vault has enough space for the new file created. If
         so, continue the job. Otherwise raise an error and end the job.
     (2) File resize: check if vault has enough space for the requested file size
         extension.
     (3) File snapshot/clone: check if vault has enough space for the
         stem/trunk/branch file change during snapshot/clone. If not, raise an error and
         end the job now.
     (4) Container Resize: check if vault still has enough space after shrink. If
         not, reject the request.

Test tsagexcesnp_gc_fix.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: sage_mirror_mode=high. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldegs4.
Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_VES.
Description: tsagexcesnp_gc_fix.tsc - This txn fixed a bug that EGS leader can't garbage collect ESNPs that are shutdown when EGS leader is not available

1. Create exastackup with 3 cell setup
    2. run escli as admin wallet, and  @>lsservice --filter serviceType=nodeProxies should see 1 entry
    3. shutdown all EGSs
    4. shutdown ESNP
    5. startup all EGSs back
    6. Update the _exc_egs_listener_port to EGS leader port
    7. alter cell egsEvents = "ebs_simevent[EGS_EVICT_ESNP_SIM] count=1"
    8. wait for 11 minutes, and check the below traces in EGS leader:
    [ESNP] evictExpiredESNPEntries:Evicted ESNP(name=phoenix96010_100.70.108.3_53194_10, nodeID=95, nodeInc=1, connTime=Thu Jan  1 00:00:00 1970 0 msec, disConnTime=Thu Sep 28 00:44:48 2023 861 msec)
    9. run escli as admin wallet, and @>lsservice --filter serviceType=nodeProxies should see nothing
    10. alter cell egsEvents = "ebs_simevent[EGS_EVICT_ESNP_SIM] count=off"
    11. Startup ESNP

Description: tsagexcfail_db_bs_edv.tsc - run db + bs workload parallel to service restart

1. initial Setup
        setup 3 cell blockstore (multi storage) with following params
          let oss_testing 3
          let sage_mirror_mode high
          let iscsi true
          let setup_blockstore true
          let media_type hc,ef
          let edv setup true (setup cluster + node edv with default user)
          let oss_multims_testing true

     2. setup db on vault (xrdbmsini) - create two pdbs.

     3. operations with db workload (steps 3.1 to 3.7 will run in parallel)
      3.1 service restart in parallel to all operations - cellsrv, bsmsrv
            will enable other service restarts after stabilizing the current setup in integration
        3.2 start running db workload on both pdbs
        3.3 will enable pdb carousel workloadafter Bug 36785013 is resolved
        3.4 run EDV workload (IOV + ACFS)
        3.5 run blockstore workload with iscsi attachment create 10+ volumes
            (this number is configurable - half of them on EF and haolf of them on HC),
            volume attachments (to run IOV workload), snapshots, clones, backups, on same vault
      3.6 delete volumes and snapshots in async mode
      3.7 run incremental backup operation on same vault

Test tsagexcfsaprtcn.tsc. setup=(none). flags: sage_mirror_mode=high. platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgdbconsascbug20_excld.
Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_SMARTSCAN_BUGS.
Description: tsagexcfsaprtcn.tsc - Test to check memory protection to FSA objects

The test scenario is to enable protection for all FSAs with object sizes
     larger than 6000 bytes as well as one specific small FSA, then we try
     accessing an unallocated object in each of the following FSAs.

  >> FlashLog Write Context: the object size is 224 which is smaller than
     6000. So, we expect no crashes because it is not protected.
  >> Cache Put Job Fixed Size: the object size is 6832 which is greater than
     6000. We expect a crash due to invalid write access to a read-only
     (protected) object.
  >> PredCacheGet Job Fixed Size: the object size is 1024 which is smaller
     than 6000, but we explicitly selected this FSA using
     _cell_fsa_prot_by_name to protect unallocated objects.
     Therefore, it should crash.

TXN : mhoseinz_fsa-config

Description: tsagexcgdsmartall.tsc - Test for smart ALL adverb - EXASCALE

      the command would target at all types of cell disks for grid disk
      operations.
      In the transaction - yifanch_bug-35034249, "ALL" is made
      smarter and deterministic. It will filter out cell disks of the
      primary media type on a real hardware or when
      "_cell_griddisk_cmd_smart_all_sim_sys" is explicitly configured
      (0:HC, 1:EF w/ TLC only?EF sys before X10, 2:EF w/ TLC and QLC?EF X10).

Description: tsagexcidempotence.tsc - Tests idempotency in addition and deletion of
     resources such as volumes, attachments, snapshots, backups and VIPs.

In this test, idempotency is tested through the following 3 cases:
     Case 1: 2 Curl requests with same idemp key are sent for an operation.
             This case is only for testing creation of resources.

     Case 2: 2 Curl requests with same idemp key are sent for an operation.
             This is done right after BSM/BSW restart. This case is also for
             testing creation of resources.

     Case 3: 2 Curl requests with same idemp key are sent for an operation
             with a little delay in between the requests. This case is for
             testing both creation and deletion of resources.

     Also tests creation of existing attachments with invalid and incorrect
     CHAP credentials.

     that completed successfully within the last 2 minutes, it would get a
     successful response instead of EDSLIB_EDSSERV_EXISTS error.

     Steps:
    1. Create a vault and a file in it
    2. Simulate EDS_SRV_SNAP_DIE_AFTER_COMMIT
    3. Create snapshot/clone of the file without any error

    5. Create snapshot/clone of the same file, it will throw error

Test tsagexcignmir.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: sage_mirror_mode=high. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldiov.
Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_VES.
Description: tsagexcignmir.tsc - Test for iov flags: <ignore_mirror_mismatch>
                         and <behavior_on_read_error>

Test for iov flags: <ignore_mirror_mismatch> and <behavior_on_read_error>

Flag: <verify_mirror_match>
       value: true : verify if mirror is matching, if corrupted throw error.
              false: ignore mirror mismatch, if any.
     Flag: <behavior_on_read_error>
       value: ignore: ignore any read error and continue iov read.
              throw_read_error: throw error on first read and abort iov read
              retry: retry reading till iov timer is over, if read
                     error goes away continue with read for rest of the
                     iov timer.

Test tsagexcinstall_debug_kernel.tsc. setup=(none). flags: OSS_HW_TESTING=1, cell_node=^cell_node^. platform: (none).
LRGs: (none).
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagexcinstall_debug_kernel.tsc - Install debug kernel in cell nodes

The test steps :
      1. Install the test kernel-ueknano
       a) Comment out "image_functions_clean_hd_boot" in /opt/oracle.cellos/validations/init.d/misceachboot
       b) Back up grub.cfg (/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg)
       c) Install kernel RPM
       d) List /boot directory, and get the new entries (Example: vmlinuz-5.4.17-2136.316.7.el8uek.aspen1.ol8.x86_64 and initramfs-5.4.17-2136.316.7.el8uek.aspen1.ol8.x86_64.img)
       e) Convert back the backup grub.cfg file and modify the high-lighted parts in the first menuentry in /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg  with the new entries in step d.
       f) If 'mokutil --sb-state' already returns "SecureBoot disabled" proceed with step h.
       g) else 'ubiosconfig export all -x /tmp/enabled_secureboot.xml -f -E' , Edit the /tmp/enabled_secureboot.xml file and change the setting for Secure Boot from Enabled to Disabled. That is, change this line in the file: <Attempt_Secure_Boot>Enabled</Attempt_Secure_Boot> , 'ubiosconfig import all -x /tmp/disabled_secureboot.xml -f -E -y' , then proceed with step h
       h) Reboot.
       i) Check if the kernel is installed correctly using uname.
      2. Place debug-ib-comp-err.sh under /root
      3. Put rds_rdma.conf under /etc/modprobe.d/
      4. Reboot node

Description: tsagexcload.tsc - wrapper over tsagexcload.py

This has a lot of useful functions

     loadrds
     ------------
     Loads the modules rds and rds_tcp if its not already loaded, if it fails
     to load it will store the result in resfile

     loadblkstore
     ------------
     Loads the modules rds, rds_tcp and target_core_user if its not already
     loaded, if it fails to load it will store the result in resfile

     loadmod
     ------------
     Loads the given module(s) if its not already

     ------------
     We will exit fatally thereby aborting entire lrg, if this option is not
     set

Test tsagexcmaterializedspaceusage.tsc. setup=xblockini. flags: (none). platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldvaultspace.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcmaterializedspaceusage.tsc - Test for materialized space usage

1. For volumes spaceUsed is equal to redundancy * size.
    2. For clones, make sure value of spaceUsed is equal to what EDS returns.
    3. For snapshots make sure value of spaceUsed is equal to what EDS return.

We have an attribute named redundancy. We can get it by querying escli: lsvolume --attributes redundancy.
     spaceUsed = redundancy * size
      -> When redundancy is high, spaceUsed = 3 * size.
      -> When redundancy is normal, spaceUsed = 2 * size.
      -> When redundancy is none, spaceUsed = 1 * size.

Test tsagexcmetacorruption.tsc. setup=xrdbmsini. flags: setup_blockstore=true. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexcmeta1.
Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_VOL, EXAC_VOLCORE, EXAC_VOL_LITE.
Description: tsagexcmetacorruption.tsc - Intentional Corruption and Disaster Recovery Tests

A) Intentional Corruption Test - This tests the result of incorrectly modifying a restricted field of
        the metadata structure which can be any flag, magic number, file path etc.The result of this can be
        anything from a missing volume, snapshot, backup, to service interruption.
        The test steps are as follows -
        1. Back up metafiles using the BKP option
        2. In this test, the LUN metadata binary has been converted to a human readable format to be edited
        3. Modify the magic number field.
        4. Convert the JSON file to Binary using teh CVT option of the EXCMETA tool.

     B) Disaster Recovery Test - The tool offers the possibility of recovering from the backup created,
  in the event of a disaster. The test validates that the tool will return the server to a previous
        state,the moment the backup was made.
        The test steps are as follows -
        1. Create a corrupt file with random data.
        2. Feed the corrupt file to LUN metadata using the fix 'soft' option of the EXCMETA tool.
        3. Stop the BSW and BSM services
        4. Use fix 'Recovery' option of the EXCMETA tool to restore to a previous created backup

     C) Data Consistency Test - The tool The tool has the ability to check the consistency of the data with respect to the current label.
        By data consistency, we refer to the fields of each metadata structure, in which their equality is verified between the structures
        declared in the header files in the current label and the structures built from the binary data obtained.
        If a metadata field from any header file is incorrectly updated, deleted or an unwanted field is added, the tool should throw an error
        at CVT option while converting from JSON to Binary or Vice versa. (TBD)


     CONFLUENCE LINK FOR REFERENCE -
     https://confluence.oraclecorp.com/confluence/display/~bryan.violante@oracle.com/Excmeta+functional+test

Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_VES.
Description: tsagexcmirvalid.tsc - Test for excmirvalid tool to validate mirrors in
                           files of a vault.

The tool so far accepts two types of arguments, -f filename or -v
     vaultname. If the argument is a vault type, the tool will verify all
     files inside that vault; Otherwise, the tool will verify the single file.
     The tool supports other optional arguments, -t (number of IO threads
     to do validation), -b (base directory to save the validation results)

     Sample usage:
     excmirvalid -v @TEST -t 8 -b /tmp
     excmirvalid -f @TEST/file1 -t 4 -b /tmp

Test tsagexcmiscbugs2_3cell.tsc. setup=(none). flags: oss_multims_testing=true, sage_mirror_mode=high. platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgsaexacldegs20.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcmiscbugs2_3cell.tsc - Test for MISC BUGS

Functional Test for BUG 36960421
     When drive is dropped and online again, drive is not formatted. Egs will try to
     format the drive first and sends OSS_IOCTL_EGS_CMD_CREATE_SP_OWNER to cell node.
     This ioctl is failed  with network error due to cell restart operation.

     Current we are not considering network error code in
     SPOWNER_EgsDiskOnlineJobState and not retrying it. Hence the logic assumes that
     disk status is expected to be  online status and asserting it.
     Fix is  handled network error and failconnect by cancelling online job operation
     with the fix,
     when sp owner broadcast ioctl of diskonline job fails with network error, we
     fail the job.

     when cell is reachable again,  egs will try to online all disks. also add the
     new drive

Description: tsagexcpdbcarouselworkload.tsc - run snapshot carousel with db workload

This test creates 10 pdbs, run db workload on them and in parallel
     create pdb snapshot.

1. create 10 pdbs
     2. start creating snapshots of all 10 pdbs every minute
     3. start db workload on all pdbs so that snapshot are created
        parallel to workload.
     4. At the end, list snapshots, stop workload and delete snapshots
     5. Validate if snapshots are properly created for all pdbs.

Description: tsagexcpooldcmd.tsc - Pooldisk creation precheck test

Pooldisk creation command pre-check Test

     pre-checking is added to both single and group grid disk creation and
     throw exception in following cases:
     Rule a:
     1. a pool disk already exists in the specified storagePool
        [single GD creation cmd]
     2. a pool disk with a different prefix already exists in the specified
         storagePool [group GD creation cmd]
     Rule b: [both single and group GD creation cmd]
     1. The specified storagePool has any pre-existing pool disk with a
        different media type
     2. Multiple media type of cell disks requested for pool disk creation
        (when 'ALL' is specified without other disk type qualifier with the
        changes for smart ALL)

     2. Quarantining a non-existent vault
     3. Quarantining an already quarantined vault.
     4. Unquarantining an already unquarantined vault.
     5. Crashing usereds and then performing quarantine operations on the vault.

     Added test case simulating the usreds crash and the quarantining a vault.

Test tsagexcraftlog1.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: (none). platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldegs3.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcraftlog1.tsc - RAFT LOG corruption test

Uses event simulation to simulate slow disk by adding
       15 seconds delay to the write function
     Test Steps
       The goal of the test is to verify that RAFT can handle
       the EGS Leader failover when followers run handleAppendEntries
       (1) A regular single cell 3 EGS setup
       (2) Increase the flushing latency using sim event on EGS followers
       (3) Run an escli mkuser command to create new RAFt entry
       (4) Kill the EGS leader while above command is running. The delay
           is handled by the events set earlier
       (5) Make sure after EGS leader failover, RAFT entries are handled
           correctly and no EGS crashes.

Description: tsagexcrestart_fail.tsc - restart cellsrv on cell 3, then stimulate disks failure on cell 4

Test steps:

 i.) - setup 4 cell env with db

 ii.) - - Run oltp and redolog workload

 In a loop (count 3); do

     iii.) - On cell 3 - Restart cellsrv

     iv.)  - On cell 4 - Failing two disks

      v.)  - On cell 4 - Reenable failed disks

 endloop

 vi.) make sure oltp and redolog workload ran fine

Test tsagexcrle.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: (none). platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldegs3.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcrle.tsc - RLE test for flags

Steps for testing '-l' flag:
     1. Set up Exascale stack
     2. Create a user using "escli mkuser" command
     4. Change user privileges using "escli chuser"
     5. Run "rle -l"
     6. Check rle_main.trc, it should contain correct privileges
        for nameNode related to user

     '-s' flag runs RLE in stdout mode.
     Steps for testing '-s' flag:
     1. Setup Exascale stack
     2. Run rle with "-s" option, grep + redirect output to a file
     3. Run rle with "-v" option, the output will be printed in rle_main.trc
     4. Grep for the same string and redirect output to another files
     5. Compare both the files. The output should be same.

Suites: (none).
Description: tsagexcscrubtest.tsc - Check scrub io back off on workload run

Test for bug-34797913:PROVIDE A NEW METRIC TO DISTINGUISH SCRUB
       LATENCY. This script tests if disk scrub IOs back down when
        workload is run.

This test validates backing of scrub IOs when workload is run
     Test steps are as follows:
      1: Start scrub operation on the cell
      2: Record total number of current scrub IOs -> preWorkloadIo
      3: Setup orion on the cell node
      4: Run orion workload on all griddisks on the cell
          with diskType as harddisk
      5: Record total number of current scrub IOs -> inWorkloadIo
     Requirements:
      1: ASM deployment
      2: All ASM diskgroups need to be mounted for scrub operation

Test tsagexcsecuritykey.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: oss_multims_testing=true, sage_mirror_mode=high. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexccloudcli2.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcsecuritykey.tsc - security certificate test for exacli

This test checks uploading a security certificate on exacli
       -   Its extension of test file tsagsecuritykey.tsc
       -   We added check specific to Exascale 3 times after List security Certificate
              1. Restart all services using `alter cell restart services all`
              2. Make sure all Exascale services are online
              3. Make sure there are no new alerts using `cellcli -e list alerthistory`
       -   Make sure EGS cluster is down. Please shutdown ERS, SYSEDS, and USREDS using 'alter cell shutdown services ers' only in cell1 and cell2
       -   Upload public key and private key using
             - alter cell securityPrivKey="file:///^OSS_HOME^/test/tsage/sosd/pkcs8.rootca.key",securityPubKey="file:///^OSS_HOME^/test/tsage/sosd/adc01drc.rootca.cer"
       -   Restart MS
       -   Check to see if this alert is present in alerthistory: "local security credential update succeeded. But security credential synchronization with Exascale failed with the following error The ExaCTRL server experienced an error. Retry the command."
       -   Revert the upload using cellcli -e alter cell securityCert=?default?
       -   Restart MS
       -   Startup EGS cluster
       -   Redo the public key and private key upload using
             - alter cell securityPrivKey="file:///^OSS_HOME^/test/tsage/sosd/pkcs8.rootca.key",securityPubKey="file:///^OSS_HOME^/test/tsage/sosd/adc01drc.rootca.cer"
       -   Restart MS
       -   Check if the following clear alert is present in alerthistory: "Security credential synchronization with Exascale succeeded."

Test tsagexcspresurrect.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: egs_trace=highest, fc_disk_trace_level=high, vault_db=DATA. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldegs15.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_FAILURE_LITE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcspresurrect.tsc - Creating new storagepool after deletion

Tests populates a storagepool to ensure the population of XRMEM
     backing it, then drops it before recreating  a new storagepool
     using dropped and recreated GrdDisks. Any data that may represent
     the new GridDisks, including the EDS metadata should not be returned
     by the XRMem cache when the new storagepool is being created or after.
     It is difficult to mimic the exact signature with branch and extent
     information for the EDSmetadata (which reports an ORA-700 in case of
     stale or bad data being read back) so the test attempts to maximize
     the XRMem cache population as the best effort. While RDBMS as the
     workload driver for the same is acceptable, iov allows for easy
     debugging in case of XRMEM cache issues like mirror mismatches, etc.

Initial goal is to create a simple test case with a single cell
     which can then be augmented with multiple cells and posible
     testing combinations. Donor file: tsagexcnspc.tsc

Test tsagexcsrvredund.tsc. setup=(none). flags: sage_mirror_mode=high, setup_blockstore=true, oss_multims_testing=true. platform: (none).
LRGs: lrgdbcsaexcsrvredund2.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcsrvredund.tsc - Test for RS Redundancy Checks

Test steps -

      Check for each service - BSM, BSW, ERS, EGS, SYSEDS, USREDS
1. Find 2 cells on which service is running
2. Shutdown service on a cell
3. Make sure service is gone using ps
	4. Switch to second cell
5. Offline same service on second cell
	6. The command should immediately fail with error
7. Restart same service on second cell
   8. The command should immediately fail with error
   9. Restart the service with 'ignore redundancy'
   10. Restart should pass
   11. Shut down the service with 'ignore redundancy'
   12. Shutdown should pass
   13. Restart service for next step
   14. Restart EGS Leader (except for EGS)
   15. Switch back to first cell
   16. Startup service on first cell
   17. Shutdown the service on the second cell, to confirm that it can go
       offline
   18. Start up the service

   Shutdown All Case
   1. Shut down all services on one cell
   2. confirm that none of those services can be shut down on a second cell
   3. check RS status - should be alive
   4. Restart all the service with 'ignore redundancy'
   5. Restart should pass
   6. Restart without ignore redundancy - should fail
   7. switch back to cell1 and startup all services

LRGs: (none).
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagexcuncomgc1.tsc - Test for file level TIME-TO-LIVE(TTL) for uncommitted files

This change introduces a per-file time-to-live (TTL, in seconds) for entries in
     the on-disk uncommitted file hash table. This requirement is realized to support
     Object Store PUT API which creates and writes to temp files before renaming on
     commit. If the API server crashes mid-PUT, these temp files may linger,
     consuming storage and impacting billing, space availability, and list-object API
     performance. This change enables timely garbage collection of such uncommitted
     files.

Test tsagexcvaultspaceusage.tsc. setup=xblockini. flags: (none). platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexacldvaultspace.
Suites: EXAC_CORE, EXAC_REGRESS.
Description: tsagexcvaultspaceusage.tsc - Functional test for Space usage

1. Create vault of size 100X
   2. Create file/volume of size > 100X (fails)
   3. Create file/volume of size <= 100X (success)
   4. Create files/volumes of total size > 100X (the files after total size > 100X, fail)
   5. Create files/volumes of total size <= 100X (all are successfully created)
   6. Create files/volumes of total size = 90X, create clone for the files (will use 10% i.e 9X size, successful)
   7. Create files/volumes of total size = 99X, create clone for the files (will use 9.9X, total 108.9X, fails)
   8. Create files/volumes of total size = 80X, create clone for the files (will use 10% i.e 8X size, successful)
   9. Create files/volumes of total size = 80X, create clone for the files, start filling the clone with > 20X (Total size > 100X, fails)
   10. Delete few files/volumes from 100X full vault, recreate with sizes less than deleted files (success)
   11. Delete few files/volumes from 100X full vault, recreate with sizes more than deleted files (fails)
   12. Delete few files/volumes from 100X full vault, fill the remaining clones with sizes less than deleted files ( success)
   13. Delete few files/volumes from 100X full vault, fill the remaining clones with sizes less than deleted files ( fails).
   14. xsh vault space usage commands
       1. xsh version (software version and label date in one line)
       2. xsh ls -sh (h for human readable size)
       3. xsh ls -s
       4. Space used metrics of one vault:
             xsh ls -sh @DATA
       5. Details of multiple vaults:
             xsh ls -sh
       6. Details of multiple files:
             xsh ls -dh @DATA/
       7. Details of one file:
             xsh ls -dh @DATA/file
       8.Added negative test cases

Description: tsagexcvesrpmrebal.tsc - Active client test rpm rebalance

1. Setup 3 cell exastack for exascale delta resync false
      2. Create a file @TEST/IOVTESTFILE -r 3 -f 0x200 -s 1g and keep IOV
         running using ves_base_long_rw.xml.
      3. Use exciogen to perform a translate on the IOV file, Save the rpm
         Id 6005b2 removing the prefix 'c0'.
      4. Offline the griddisk via "cellcli -e alter griddisk <diskname> inactive",
         wait for EGS to offline it Wait for 60s, keep IOV workload running
      5. Do a state dump via cellcli -e "alter cell events='immediate
         cellsrv.cellsrv_statedump(0)'"
      6. Use escli command "escli --wallet $T_WORK/esadmin_wallet lspooldisk 74"
         to get disk
      7. Simulate predictive failure on it and wait for rebalance to complete
      8. On each cell, do a cellsrv state dump, then grep -A1 "Printing ongoing",
         it should look like following without additional message:
      9. Cancel the failure
      10. Active the inactive disk via alter griddisk xxx active

Test tsagexcvesgddefrag.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: vault_db=DATA, sage_mirror_mode=high. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: lrgsaexcdefrag.
Suites: EXAC_REGRESS, EXAC_VES.
Description: tsagexcvesgddefrag.tsc - Test for griddisk defragmentation

Test for a new feature - VES griddisk defragmentation
      It combines small 8k allocations into 64k and above large
       allocations.
      Test Scenario -
       1. create a file and create a snapshot of it
       2. write 7 8k blocks to the file using xsh
       3. Do ves allocation dump, we should see seven smallAlloc on snap 1
          and isDefragNeeded is 0 for that extent
       4. After writing the 8th 8k block, isDefragNeeded should become 1
       5. Trigger defrag through md_resync command
       6. After defrag, we should see a 64k large allocation on snap 1

Test tsagexcveshardchk.tsc. setup=tsagexastackup. flags: sage_mirror_mode=high, cmd_mirror_mode=normal, delta_sync=true. platform: EXASCALE.
LRGs: (none).
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagexcveshardchk.tsc - VES Hardcheck failure test

Set stackup with 3 cells
     edstool create @TEST/IOVTESTFILE -s 144m -r 3 -b 8k
     shut down the cellsrv
     run iov on @TEST/IOVTESTFILE with read/write
     Restart the cellsrv
     Simulate 1000-count retry
     Grep for hardChecks failed, insert into BadOffsetExtList
     edstool create @TEST/IOVTESTFILE2 -s 64m -r 3 -b 512
     shut down the cellsrv
     xsh dd --if=/dev/urandom --out=@TEST/IOVTESTFILE2 --bs=1M --count=64
     run iov on @TEST/IOVTESTFILE2 with read/write
     Restart the cellsrv
     Simulate 1-count retry
     Grep for HARD checks failed: retries: 0, hardchk: .*, hardftyp: .*, hardblksz: 512, cgtyp: .*
     edstool create @TEST/IOVTESTFILE3 -s 64m -r 3 -b 16384
     shut down the cellsrv
     xsh dd --if=/dev/urandom --out=@TEST/IOVTESTFILE3 --bs=1M --count=64
     run iov on @TEST/IOVTESTFILE3 with read/write
     Restart the cellsrv
     Simulate 1000-count retry
     Grep for HARD checks failed: retries: 1, hardchk: .*, hardftyp: .*, hardblksz: 16384, cgtyp: .*

LRGs: (none).

Description: tsagbugsimulation.tsc - Test for BUG 16363462: NEED A MECHANISM TO SIMULATE COMMAND EXECUTION AND IOCTL FAILURES/TIMEOUT/ERRORS

The test adds a new underscore parameter to cellinit.ora called _cmd_failure_simulation_pattern to simulate failures.

The test file will add a new underscore parameter to cellinit.ora called _cmd_failure_simulation_pattern
with a pattern and a return value.
If CommandExecutionUtil finds a match, then it will not execute that command.
It will instead return the retval specified in the underscore parameter.

Test tsagfakeiberrsim.tsc. setup=srdbmsini. flags: (none). platform: EXADATA.
LRGs: lrgdbcsapmemlog7.
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagfakeiberrsim.tsc - adding failure simulation in fakeib

adding failure simulation in fakeib, so that IPCDAT RDMA error code-paths can be exercised over fake hardware.

test cases present:
1. The test can set the following parameter in fakeib.prm _fakeib_error_sim=create_cq exclude=cellsrv retcode=22 count=100 interval=1. Setting this parameter will result in fakeib simulating errors while creating
  RDMA completion queues with a 50% probability. IPCDAT context creation can fail when error simulation is enabled for create_cq. That means RDMA operations will
  not be performed.So, the test can take that into account. The database should still successfully startup and workload should complete.

Test tsagfakeiberrsim_destroy_qp.tsc. setup=srdbmsini. flags: (none). platform: EXADATA.
LRGs: lrgdbcsapmemlog1.
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagfakeiberrsim_destroy_qp.tsc

adding failure simulation in fakeib using parameter fakeib_error_sim during RDMA QueuePair destruction.

The test set the following parameter in fakeib.prm _fakeib_error_sim: type=destroy_qp count=250 retcode=16.
     The error simulation using above parameter will exercise the lesser taken code paths in the QP's life-cycle
     and will target all modules that directly/in-directly create QPs such as IFD, PMemLog (both client and cellsrv), PMemCache etc.

Test tsagfastmetadata.tsc. setup=(none). flags: oss_failgroup=failalldbdg, OSS_ENABLE_FC_PERSISTENCE=off, OSS_ENABLE_NC_PERSISTENCE=writeback, exa_cdb=true, processes=200, sessions=220, oss_auto_manage_disks=true. platform: (none).
LRGs: (none).
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagfastmetadata.tsc - faster metadata test

This test validates update and persistence of celldisk metadata
     to disk in case of flashcache/pmemcache failure. Now after xqliu_flashfailureopt
     transaction metadata persistence would be speed up by temporarily
     persisting celldisk metadata to system SSD. This temporal write would
     only be triggered when celldisk is busy and a system SSD is available.So there
     could be a significant speed up for flash cache failure and resilver
     on x7 or later systems with a proper threshold value.

     Normally the temporal metadata would be deleted after celldisk metadata
     write, but if cellsrv crashes before deleting it, the metadata would be
     read during next bootstrap, then be deleted.

to be added in lrgdbcsafastermetadata

Test tsagfault.tsc. setup=srdbmsini. flags: testlogfile=tsagqnt.log, pidlogfile=tsagqmpid.log, asm_cluster=^cur_cluster_guid^':', creatdev_file=tsagr2def, _rdbms_internal_fplib_enabled=false, cell_offload_plan_display=ALWAYS. platform: EXADATA.
LRGs: lrgdbconsafault.
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagfault.tsc - Fault Isolation tests for Exadata

With fault isolation, cellsrv will try to detect which entity
     previously caused a cell crash. Once cellsrv detects such an entity,
     it will quarantine it. When the same entity comes again, cellsrv
     won't do "predicate-push" for it.

LRGs: lrgrhx11sadaxorion.
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagfc_xrmc_resiliency.tsc - Test for resiliency of FlashCache and XRMemCache
                                  by running I/O workloads, recreating cache, restarting cell services

1. Copy Orion from the local directory to the cell node using SSH as root and place it in the target directory
   2. In OSSCONF, create cellip ora with cell equals ipaddress:5042, using ipaddress one or ipaddress two from cellinit ora
   3. Create one gigabyte griddisks for all celldisks with the command create griddisk DATA CD zero zero hostname celldisk equals CD zero zero hostname offset equals thirty two megabytes size equals one GB
   4. Create the gds lun file and populate its contents
   5. Ensure FlashCacheMode is set to WriteBack and use cellcli commands to check or set
   6. Ensure FlashCache and XRMemCache exist and create them with cellcli if needed
   7. Wait for griddisks to show cachedBy as updated or sleep for two minutes
   8. Start the Orion workload using the appropriate advanced random command
   9. Run ecstat with count four and observe FlashCache writes and disk reads
  10. Stop the Orion workload after the test by finding its process ID and killing the process
  11. Recreate FlashCache with cellcli by flushing dropping creating and listing
  12. Repeat validation after cache re creation
  13. Kill cellsrv and run ecstat with count five until cellsrv restarts disk read IO per second should be zero

Test tsagfcgroupmon.tsc. setup=tsaginit. flags: asm_disk_def=tsagrdmadef, cell_with_ram_cache=0, cell_with_pmem_cache=0. platform: EXADATA.
LRGs: lrgsafciovgroup3.
Suites: (none).
Description: tsagfcgroupmon.tsc - Test case for bug 32764765

Test case for bug 32764765

Test steps for below bug:
     Bug# 32764765 - STABLE_E2POD:FLASHCACHE ENHANCEMENT,MONITOR FC GROUP PERIODICALLY AND PROACTIVELY REMOVE EMPTY GROUPS

     1. No asm-db is needed. This will be a pure cell test. Create writeback FC, disable ramcache and pmemcache.

     2. Use the IORM debug action to fake several DBs.
     alter cell events = 'cellsrv.cellsrv_iorm_ctl[FAKE_DBS] opval=10'

     3. Enable IORM plan for database "TEST5".
     alter iormplan dbplan=((name=test5, share=1, flashcache=on))
     list iormplan detail

     4. Run orion workload on dbid=5 to populate flashcache. 100% read test would be fine.
     $ADE_VIEW_ROOT/rdbms/bin/orion -run advanced -type rand -matrix point -testname test1 -size_small 8 -num_large 0 -num_small 8
      -write 0 -duration 60 -dbid 5

     5. After the workload, query flashcachecontent. The content should all cached data are from dbid=5 (TEST5).
     list flashcachecontent detail

     6. Perform a FC group dump. And grep "FC GROUPS COUNT" in fcgroup dump. There would be 2 groups.
        One is for system default group, the other is for TEST5.
     alter cell events="immediate cellsrv.cellsrv_flashcache(dumpgroups, 0, 0, 1)";

     7. Set IORM plan for database TEST6.
     alter iormplan dbplan=((name=test6, share=1, flashcache=on))
     list iormplan detail
     list flashcachecontent where dbID=6 detail

     8. Run orion workload on dbid=6 to populate TEST6 data into FC, which would evict TEST5 cached data.
     $ADE_VIEW_ROOT/rdbms/bin/orion -run advanced -type rand -matrix point -testname test1 -size_small 8 -num_large 0
      -num_small 8 -write 0 -duration 120 -dbid 6

     9. After the workload, query flashcachecontent. The content should all cached data are from dbid=6 (TEST6).
     list flashcachecontent detail

     10. Perform a FC group dump. And grep "FC GROUPS COUNT" in fcgroup dump. There would be 3 groups.
         One is for system default group, one is for TEST5, and the other is for TEST6.
     alter cell events="immediate cellsrv.cellsrv_flashcache(dumpgroups, 0, 0, 1)";

     11. Set new cell parameter _cell_fc_group_gc_threshold_in_sec to 30 seconds. And sleep 30 seconds.
     alter cell events = "immediate cellsrv.cellsrv_setparam('_cell_fc_group_gc_threshold_in_sec', 30)";
     alter cell events = "immediate cellsrv.cellsrv_getparam('_cell_fc_group_gc_threshold_in_sec')";
     sleep 30

     12. Run FC debug action to trigger the FC monitor.
     alter cell events="immediate cellsrv.cellsrv_flashcache(monitor, 0, 0, 1)" ;

     13. Perform a FC group dump. And grep "FC GROUPS COUNT" in fcgroup dump. There would be 2 groups.
         One is for system default group, one is for TEST6. And there is no more group for TEST5.
     alter cell events="immediate cellsrv.cellsrv_flashcache(dumpgroups, 0, 0, 1)";

Description: tsagfcgroupmove.tsc - test case for bug 33387010

Test case for bug 33387010.

     (1) Create 2 test DBS (TEST5 & TEST6) and set default IORM plan.
     (2) Run orion read workload on 300MB disk area to populate all data
         into TEST6.
     (3) Run orion read workload on 150MB disk area to switch cached
         TEST6 content to TEST5 content. All reads should get cache hit.
     (4) Set hardMax=200MB for TEST6.
     (5) Run orion read workload on 300MB disk area again to simulate
         database change of the cached data. All reads should get cache
         hit, even when cachedSize of TEST6 has reached hardMax limit.
